messageBody:
So said Alok Daipuria on 2003-02-25 --------------------

>I have an existing test case class which I extended to add few more
test
>cases. When I run the extended test case, it runs the test cases from
the
>base class as well. Is there a flag or something which I can use to
>suppress
>running test cases present in the base class.
> Here's an example of the scenario :
>
> class A extends TestCase
> {
> public testA() {}
> }
>
> class B extends A
> {
> public testB() {}
> }
>
> When I execute class B, it runs both testA() and testB(), which I
want to
>avoid for now. I need to extend to be able to use the setup/teardown
done
>by
>A.

The solution is straight Java inheritance, and not JUnit-related. Pull
out the code from A that you want B to use, then create a common
superclass.

Good luck.
